html:
Etymology[edit]

Frequentative of pendō.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ˈpen.so/, [ˈpẽː.sɔ]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ˈpen.so/, [ˈpɛn.sɔ]

Verb[edit]

pēnsō (present infinitive pēnsāre, perfect active pēnsāvī, supine pēnsātum); first conjugation

  1. I ponder, consider
  2. I weigh, counterbalance
  3. I pay for, purchase
  4. (Medieval Latin) I think

Derived terms[edit]

  • compēnsō
  • dispēnsō
  • expēnsō
  • pēnsum
  • perpēnsō
  • repēnsō
 

Descendants[edit]

Inherited forms
  • Aragonese: pesar
  • Asturian: pesar
  • Catalan: pesar
  • Corsican: pesà, pisà
  • Extremaduran: pesal
  • Friulian: pesâ
  • Galician: pesar
  • Istriot: pazà
  • Italian: pesare
  • Leonese: pesare
  • Ligurian: pezâ
  • Navarro-Aragonese: pesar
  • Occitan: pesar
  • Old French: peser, poiser
    • Anglo-Norman: peiser
      • → English: peise
    • Middle French: peser, poiser
      • French: peser
    • Jersey Norman: p'ser
  • Old Occitan: pesar
  • Piedmontese: peisé
  • Portuguese: pesar
  • Romanian: păsa, păsare
  • Sardinian: pessare, pessai
  • Sicilian: pisari
  • Sassarese: pinsà
  • Spanish: pesar
  • Venetian: pexar
Semi-learned borrowed forms
  • → Corsican: pensà (semi-learned), pinsà, penzà
  • → Extremaduran: pensal (semi-learned)
  • → Friulian: pensâ (semi-learned)
  • → Gallurese: pinsà (semi-learned), pinzà
  • → Istriot: pansà (semi-learned)
  • → Italian: pensare (semi-learned)
  • → Leonese: pensare (semi-learned)
    • Asturian: pensar
  • → Ligurian: pensâ (semi-learned)
  • → Mirandese: pensar (semi-learned)
  • → Neapolitan: penzà (semi-learned)
  • → Navarro-Aragonese: pensar (semi-learned)
    • → Aragonese: pensar (semi-learned)
  • → Old French: penser (semi-learned)
    • Middle French: penser
      • French: penser, panser
      • Norman:
        • Guernsey Norman: pensaïr
        • Jersey Norman: penser
    • Walloon: pinser
  • → Old Occitan: pensar (semi-learned)
    • → Catalan: pensar (semi-learned)
    • → Occitan: pensar (semi-learned)
  • → Old Portuguese: pensar (semi-learned)
    • Galician: pensar
    • Portuguese: pensar
      • → Papiamentu: pensa
  • → Old Spanish: pensar (semi-learned)
    • Spanish: pensar
  • → Piedmontese: pensé (semi-learned)
  • → Romansch: pensar (semi-learned), pansar, penser
  • → Sardinian: pensare (semi-learned), pentzare, penciare, penciare, pensai, pentzai, penciai
  • → Sicilian: pinsari (semi-learned), pinzari
  • → Sassarese: pinsà (semi-learned)
  • → Tarantino: pinser (semi-learned)
  • → Venetian: pensar (semi-learned)
True borrowed forms
  • → Albanian: peshoj
  • → Greek: πενσέω (penséo)

References[edit]

  • penso in Charlton T. Lewis and Charles Short (1879) A Latin Dictionary, Oxford: Clarendon Press
  • penso in Charlton T. Lewis (1891) An Elementary Latin Dictionary, New York: Harper & Brothers
  • penso in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
  • Carl Meissner; Henry William Auden (1894) Latin Phrase-Book‎[1], London: Macmillan and Co.
    • to return evil for good: benefacta maleficiis pensare
